info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 12:39PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Fulton and central Montgomery Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1239 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gloversville, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Johnstown, Fonda, Tribes Hill, Berkshire, Fultonville, Bleecker, Auriesville, Meco, West Bush, Smiths Corners, Progress, Bleecker Center, Church Corners, Sammonsville, Bowlers Corners, Dennies Crossing, Berryville, Hale Mills and Kingsboro. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
